abstract: Background: Phenotyping, the process of systematically identifying and classifying conditions within clinical data, is a crucial first step in any data science work involving Electronic Health Records (EHRs). Traditional approaches require extensive manual …

title: Understanding contraceptive switching rationales from real world clinical notes using large language models

abstract: Understanding reasons for treatment switching is of significant medical interest, but these factors are often only found in unstructured clinical notes and can be difficult to extract. We evaluated the zero-shot abilities of GPT-4 and eight other open-source …

title: Benchmarking large language models for biomedical natural language processing applications and recommendations

abstract: The rapid growth of biomedical literature poses challenges for manual knowledge curation and synthesis. Biomedical Natural Language Processing (BioNLP) automates the process. While Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown promise …
